summary: President Donald Trump said the tariffs he threatened against Apple Inc. earlier Friday would also be aimed at a wider range of device makers . Trump indicated that the import levies would be “appropriately done” and ready for implementation by the end of June .  Trump’s demand for US-based manufacturing pose a stark challenge to Apple and Samsung, whose supply chains for their devices have been concentrated in Asia for years . Trump also threatened a 50% tariff on the European Union that would go into effect June 1, which weighed on the broader market .  Trump’s warning on Friday took shape after Apple signaled earlier this month that new tariffs would bring as much as $900 million in higher costs in the current quarter . Apple had already planned to transfer the bulk of its US-bound iPhone production to facilities in India .  Apple said earlier this year that it plans to spend $500 billion in the US over the next four years . Moving manufacturing of its signature iPhone and other devices to the US would be an enormous and expensive undertaking for Cupertino, California-based Apple .  The change threatens to cut Apple’s gross margin by 3 to 3.5 percentage points in fiscal 2026 . But moving iPhone production to the US would likely still be far more costly than paying the tariff . Sergey Brin will actively work on Gemini, the tech giant’s flagship platform, spearheading AI innovations . Brin says he has learnt valuable lessons from mistakes made on the Google Glass project . Brin’s comeback and focus on Gemini is a clear indication that the search giant is ready to take the fight to OpenAI, which has threatened to disrupt its dominance on search with ground-breaking AI innovations . Google is investing up to $150 million in a partnership with Warby Parker and acquiring stock in the eyewear startup .

The Chicago Sun-Times newspaper released a "Summer Reading lLst for 2025" as part of its "Best of Summer" section . The list ended up being made-up book titles from real authors and even later tricked Google-owned search engine .  Other sections of the Best of Summer Heat Index special featured AI-generated sections . Quotes from experts appear to be made up or from people who are not real experts in their respective fields . "We are looking into how this made it into print as we speak," the Sun-Times said .  Searching for "Tidewater Dreams Isabel Allende" on Google today reveals a different result . Google says the book title is not a recognized literary work . Allende is a real author .  Not everything you read on the internet is true and not everything that appears in Google searches is true . It's always important to check and verify sources and, in some cases, look for more than one source .  Fake Books, Real Deception: How AI-Generated Summer Reading List Fooled Google, Readers . Google's summer reading list fooled Google, readers .

Google unveiled a new search engine feature dubbed AI Mode to fend off stiff competition in the lucrative online search business . The new AI search feature functions like a chatbot, allowing people to start queries, ask follow-up questions, and use AI systems to deliver comprehensive answers .  The defensive play comes as Alphabet looks to safeguard its search business, which accounts for about 56% of the company’s total revenues . Google is cementing its status as the go-to search engine as it seeks to fend off stiff competition from AI competitors .

Ad revenues increased 61% year over year to $358.6 million in the first quarter of 2025 .  RDDT expanded its collaboration withIntegral Ad ScienceIAS in April to offer advertisers enhanced campaigns . The company’s expanding portfolio has been a key catalyst .  Integral Ad Science’s Total Media Quality for Reddit now delivers greater transparency, comprehensive reporting, and advanced AI-driven technology . For the second quarter of 2025, the Zacks Consensus Estimate for revenues is pegged at $426.12 million, indicating year-over-year growth of 51.55% .  Snapchat’s growing ad offerings and advanced features are attracting both advertisers and users, challenging Reddit’S market position . In the first quarter of 2025, Google advertising revenues rose 8.5% year over year and accounted for 74.1% of total revenues .  Reddit’s prospects benefit from an expanding advertising business, expanding clientele and improving the user experience with upgraded search and discovery features . The company is suffering from intense competition from other social media platforms, which is consistently affecting user engagement and market share in advertising . The US Justice Department is examining whether Alphabet’s Google violated antitrust regulations through a deal involving the AI technology of Character.AI, a well-known chatbot developer . Regulators are assessing whether the tech giant crafted the agreement to avoid formal merger oversight .  The inquiry is in its preliminary phase, and no accusations of misconduct have been made against Google . The probe may not lead to any enforcement action, the report added . Character.AI was founded by ex-Google researchers who later rejoined the company with part of their research team .  Earlier in May 2025, Google agreed to pay the State of Texas$1.375bn to resolve data-privacy claims . A decision is anticipated this summer .

The order is expected to fast track the development of nuclear power stations in the U.S. It would then supply the huge data centres required for AI . The Trump administration is seeking ways to counter the ‘huge resources” being deployed by China .  Mr Trump declared a national energy emergency on his first day back in the White House in January . The executive order aims to ease the process to approve new nuclear reactors and bolster supply chains . The US was the first country to develop nuclear power and has 94 nuclear reactors, supplying 97 gigawatts of energy .  Google has also signed a contract with energy company Kairos Power to use its small nuclear reactor to power its AI data centres . It aims to be powered by Kairos’s first reactor before the end of the decade, with the company set to open more by 2035 . Trump is also expected to use the Defense Production Act, which dates back to the Cold War-era, to declare a national emergency over US' dependence on Russia and China for enriched uranium .  A draft summary of the executive order is also said to direct government agencies to permit new nuclear facilities . The departments of energy and defence will also be required to identify federal lands and facilities that can be used for nuclear deployment . In the US nuclear power has bipartisan support with Democrats in favour of building new reactors .

Googledemonstratedsmart glasses powered by its Android XR platform and announced that eyewear makers Warby Parker and Gentle Monster would be selling products based on it . The next day, OpenAI unveiled its$6.5 billion acquisition of Jony Ive’s startup IO, which will put the Apple design legend at the center of the ChatGPT maker's quest to build devices around its AI .  Android XR scratches the same itch Google has had since it unveiled its ill-fated Google Glassa dozen years ago . Apple hopes to release its own Siri-enhanced smart glasses next year .  Google's Android XR prototype resembles a slightly chunky pair of conventional glasses . It uses a conversational voice interface and a transparent mini-display that floats on your view of your surroundings . Google says shipping products will have “all-day” battery life, a claim that Glass could never make .  The announcement of the merger of OpenAI and IO’s merger was as polished as a Jony Ive-designed product . Altman and Ive smothered each other in praise and talked about reinventing computing . Absent any specifics, Altman's assessment of one of Ive's prototypes sounded like runaway enthusiasm at best and Barnumesque puffery at worst .  Jin cites Altman predicting that it will sell 100 million units faster than any product before it . In 2007, by contrast, Apple forecast selling a more modest 10 million iPhones in the phone’s first full year on the market .  You can't accuse Apple of hyping any smart glasses it might release in 2026 . Until you have a product in the market, it’s better to tamp down expectations than stoke them . Even companies that aren’t presently trying to earn back their AI cred should take note .  Plugged In is Fast Company’s weekly tech newsletter from me, global technology editor Harry McCracken . If anything released next year gets there, it might bethelandmark AI gizmo we haven’t yet seen .  A new app, Verb.AI, wants to pay the generation that’s most laissez-faire on digital privacy for their scrolling time . As AI evolves, businesses should use the technology to complement, not replace, human workers .  Without spending a dime, you can make your money without having to spend it . You can do so much more than a million dollars without spending a dollar . The company is now focusing on the next generation of tech entrepreneurs .

Nvidia has a dominant market share in the GPU space . Alphabet's AI search advantages are largely being ignored by investors . It created the free software platform to allow developers to be able to program its chips for purposes beyond their original intent of helping speed up graphics rendering in video games .  The company does not have a recurring revenue stream like a software company, so it relies on increased demand for its chips . Right now, it appears that AI infrastructure spending is poised to continue to ramp up . However, there is no doubt that AI chatbots are gaining momentum and beginning to become more mainstream . Google Search doesn't make much money from searches involving things like helping students with a biology paper .  Alphabet is the default search engine on most devices connected to the internet . It also has a Shop by AI Mode that can find items based on your description, let you try on outfits virtually using an uploaded photo of yourself . Quantum computing is an incredibly promising technology that could unlock new ways to solve some of the world's most complex problems . Multiple companies are investing heavily in this arms race, and businesses of all sizes are vying for quantum computing supremacy . Alphabet kicked off the quantum computing investment trend with the announcement of its Willow quantum computing chip .  Traditional computing transmits information in bits, either a 0 or a 1, so traditional computing isn't prone to errors . Quantum computing utilizes qubits, which transmit information as the probability of an answer being 0 or 1 . On the downside, there is room for errors to develop because the answer isn't explicitly a 0 . Google's solution was to arrange the qubits in a grid-like pattern to reduce the errors each qubit has .  One of the more popular pure-play investments in the quantum computing arms race is IonQ . IonQ relies on external contracts to fund the company, which it realizes as revenue . For both Microsoft and Alphabet, $7.5 million is a rounding error, and they can afford to throw more resources at quantum computing .  This is a key factor in the AI arms race: The big tech giants can outspend the start-ups . While David and Goliath stories exist for a reason, with how much research and intense computing power are needed to get quantum computing to a usable point, I want to invest in the bigger players . As another benefit, they still have a strong base business to lean on if either of these two loses the quantum computing arms race . President Donald Trump said the tariffs he threatened against Apple Inc. earlier Friday would also be aimed at a wider range of device makers . Trump indicated that the import levies would be “appropriately done” and ready for implementation by the end of June .  Trump’s demand for US-based manufacturing pose a stark challenge to Apple and Samsung, whose supply chains for their devices have been concentrated in Asia for years . Trump also threatened a 50% tariff on the European Union that would go into effect June 1, which weighed on the broader market .  Trump’s warning on Friday took shape after Apple signaled earlier this month that new tariffs would bring as much as $900 million in higher costs in the current quarter . Apple had already planned to transfer the bulk of its US-bound iPhone production to facilities in India .  Apple said earlier this year that it plans to spend $500 billion in the US over the next four years . Moving manufacturing of its signature iPhone and other devices to the US would be an enormous and expensive undertaking for Cupertino, California-based Apple .  The change threatens to cut Apple’s gross margin by 3 to 3.5 percentage points in fiscal 2026 . But moving iPhone production to the US would likely still be far more costly than paying the tariff . The Chicago Sun-Times newspaper released a "Summer Reading lLst for 2025" as part of its "Best of Summer" section . The list ended up being made-up book titles from real authors and even later tricked Google-owned search engine .  Other sections of the Best of Summer Heat Index special featured AI-generated sections . Quotes from experts appear to be made up or from people who are not real experts in their respective fields . "We are looking into how this made it into print as we speak," the Sun-Times said .  Searching for "Tidewater Dreams Isabel Allende" on Google today reveals a different result . Google says the book title is not a recognized literary work . Allende is a real author .  Not everything you read on the internet is true and not everything that appears in Google searches is true . It's always important to check and verify sources and, in some cases, look for more than one source .  Fake Books, Real Deception: How AI-Generated Summer Reading List Fooled Google, Readers . Google's summer reading list fooled Google, readers .

The US Justice Department is examining whether Alphabet’s Google violated antitrust regulations through a deal involving the AI technology of Character.AI, a well-known chatbot developer . Regulators are assessing whether the tech giant crafted the agreement to avoid formal merger oversight .  The inquiry is in its preliminary phase, and no accusations of misconduct have been made against Google . The probe may not lead to any enforcement action, the report added . Character.AI was founded by ex-Google researchers who later rejoined the company with part of their research team .  Earlier in May 2025, Google agreed to pay the State of Texas$1.375bn to resolve data-privacy claims . A decision is anticipated this summer .

The order is expected to fast track the development of nuclear power stations in the U.S. It would then supply the huge data centres required for AI . The Trump administration is seeking ways to counter the ‘huge resources” being deployed by China .  Mr Trump declared a national energy emergency on his first day back in the White House in January . The executive order aims to ease the process to approve new nuclear reactors and bolster supply chains . The US was the first country to develop nuclear power and has 94 nuclear reactors, supplying 97 gigawatts of energy .  Google has also signed a contract with energy company Kairos Power to use its small nuclear reactor to power its AI data centres . It aims to be powered by Kairos’s first reactor before the end of the decade, with the company set to open more by 2035 . Trump is also expected to use the Defense Production Act, which dates back to the Cold War-era, to declare a national emergency over US' dependence on Russia and China for enriched uranium .  A draft summary of the executive order is also said to direct government agencies to permit new nuclear facilities . The departments of energy and defence will also be required to identify federal lands and facilities that can be used for nuclear deployment . In the US nuclear power has bipartisan support with Democrats in favour of building new reactors .

Googledemonstratedsmart glasses powered by its Android XR platform and announced that eyewear makers Warby Parker and Gentle Monster would be selling products based on it . The next day, OpenAI unveiled its$6.5 billion acquisition of Jony Ive’s startup IO, which will put the Apple design legend at the center of the ChatGPT maker's quest to build devices around its AI .  Android XR scratches the same itch Google has had since it unveiled its ill-fated Google Glassa dozen years ago . Apple hopes to release its own Siri-enhanced smart glasses next year .  Google's Android XR prototype resembles a slightly chunky pair of conventional glasses . It uses a conversational voice interface and a transparent mini-display that floats on your view of your surroundings . Google says shipping products will have “all-day” battery life, a claim that Glass could never make .  The announcement of the merger of OpenAI and IO’s merger was as polished as a Jony Ive-designed product . Altman and Ive smothered each other in praise and talked about reinventing computing . Absent any specifics, Altman's assessment of one of Ive's prototypes sounded like runaway enthusiasm at best and Barnumesque puffery at worst .  Jin cites Altman predicting that it will sell 100 million units faster than any product before it . In 2007, by contrast, Apple forecast selling a more modest 10 million iPhones in the phone’s first full year on the market .  You can't accuse Apple of hyping any smart glasses it might release in 2026 . Until you have a product in the market, it’s better to tamp down expectations than stoke them . Even companies that aren’t presently trying to earn back their AI cred should take note .  Plugged In is Fast Company’s weekly tech newsletter from me, global technology editor Harry McCracken . If anything released next year gets there, it might bethelandmark AI gizmo we haven’t yet seen .  A new app, Verb.AI, wants to pay the generation that’s most laissez-faire on digital privacy for their scrolling time . As AI evolves, businesses should use the technology to complement, not replace, human workers .  Without spending a dime, you can make your money without having to spend it . You can do so much more than a million dollars without spending a dollar . The company is now focusing on the next generation of tech entrepreneurs .

Quantum computing is an incredibly promising technology that could unlock new ways to solve some of the world's most complex problems . Multiple companies are investing heavily in this arms race, and businesses of all sizes are vying for quantum computing supremacy . Alphabet kicked off the quantum computing investment trend with the announcement of its Willow quantum computing chip .  Traditional computing transmits information in bits, either a 0 or a 1, so traditional computing isn't prone to errors . Quantum computing utilizes qubits, which transmit information as the probability of an answer being 0 or 1 . On the downside, there is room for errors to develop because the answer isn't explicitly a 0 . Google's solution was to arrange the qubits in a grid-like pattern to reduce the errors each qubit has .  One of the more popular pure-play investments in the quantum computing arms race is IonQ . IonQ relies on external contracts to fund the company, which it realizes as revenue . For both Microsoft and Alphabet, $7.5 million is a rounding error, and they can afford to throw more resources at quantum computing .  This is a key factor in the AI arms race: The big tech giants can outspend the start-ups . While David and Goliath stories exist for a reason, with how much research and intense computing power are needed to get quantum computing to a usable point, I want to invest in the bigger players . As another benefit, they still have a strong base business to lean on if either of these two loses the quantum computing arms race .
